turn.0: Hi, I'm your automated assistant. I can answer your questions about Ordnance Corps (United States Army).
turn.1: What expanded during World War II
turn.2: During World War II, the Ordnance Branch gained its third core competency, Bomb Disposal (renamed Explosive Ordnance Disposal after WWII) added to its previous missions of ammunition handling and maintenance.
turn.4: By war's end, there were more than 2,200 Ordnance units of approximately 40 types, ranging in size from squads to regiments.
turn.6: Beginning in 1942, with the authorization of the Chief of Ordnance, a computing branch at the University of Pennsylvania's Moore School of Electrical Engineering was established as a substation of Aberdeen Proving Ground under the code name "Project PX".
turn.8: On 15 February 1946, the Electronic Numerical Integrator and Computer (ENIAC), the world's first general-purpose electronic computer, was formally dedicated.
turn.10: ENIAC was designed to calculate artillery firing tables for the United States Army Ballistic Research Laboratory.
turn.12: The ENIAC's first use was in calculations for the hydrogen bomb.
